snippet: Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, Iran’s Supreme Leader, is making sure there will never be a Deng Xiaoping in Tehran.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Ray Takeyh, senior fellow at Council on Foreign Relations, outlines why Iran cannot follow China's example of an authoritarian political system surviving long after its ideological claims have faded, largely because of Iranian system's religious foundation.
lead_paragraph: Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, Iran’s Supreme Leader, is making sure there will never be a Deng Xiaoping in Tehran.

headline.seo: Why Iran Can’t Follow China’s Lead
headline.main: Why Iran Can’t Follow China’s Lead
headline.print_headline: Why Iran Can’t Follow China’s Lead
